channel.title: CiTR -- Uncommon Practice (2007)
channel.description: All the classical music you don't hear on mainstream radio! A variety of innovative and interesting works from the 20th and 21st centuries, with an occasional neglected masterpiece from earlier eras.
channel.itunes:summary: All the classical music you don't hear on mainstream radio! A variety of innovative and interesting works from the 20th and 21st centuries, with an occasional neglected masterpiece from earlier eras.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: All the classical music you don't hear on mainstream radio!

item.title: Broadcast on 28-May-2007
item.description: I'm leaving town for good, so this is the last Uncommon Practice ever...until another connoisseur of 20th & 21st century classical music shows up at CiTR.
item.itunes:subtitle: FAREWELL SHOW

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Mar-2007
item.description: This week: brand-new works featuring Vancouver musicians! Plus, music for cello and live electronics, a vintage wind ensemble masterpiece, and more!

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Feb-2007
item.description: This week: Minimalism, Post-Minimalism, and the New Tonality. Proof that contemporary classical music doesn't have to be ugly!

item.title: Broadcast on 22-Jan-2007
item.description: This week: Motets from the most famous living Danish composer, a concerto featuring a long-neglected orchestral instrument, selections from a film score by the one and only Ennio Morricone, and more!

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Jan-2007
item.description: What does classical music with titles like "Escalator", "Mysteries of the Macabre", and "Orpheus Behind the Wire" sound like? Listen to this week's show and find out!

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Dec-2006
item.description: This week: Christmas-influenced music, including a folksy South American cantata and a symphony by Krzysztof Penderecki. Also, recent works from Vancouver composers and lots more!
item.itunes:subtitle: special 150-minute edition

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Nov-2006
item.description:
This week:
Classical music for the accordion? Yes, indeed!
A piano with various objects stuck between its strings? You bet!
How about a work for viola, recorder, and electronics? But of course!
Ah, those contemporary composers...what will they think of next?

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Oct-2006
item.description: This week: new music by UBC composers! Also, an evocative depiction of the Armageddon by Dutch composer Henk Badings, and other spooky music in honour of Halloween.

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Oct-2006
item.description: This week: Modernism and post-Modernism, including selections from "Le marteau sans maitre" by Pierre Boulez; extemporaneous percussion improvisation; and a haunting choral work inspired by political imprisonment.

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Oct-2006
item.description: This week: Persian-influenced music for string quartet by Reza Vali; George Perle's settings of Rilke sonnets; a musical tribute to Canadian painter Harold Town; and more!
